column4: When I walk away from my computer for say a hour or so and come back the screen will be blank nad the caps lock light and the scoll lock light will be flashing. I will be unable to bring it out of the black screen it is in. Anyone know why?
Have you got a USB keyboard and mouse?
Then I am guessing your system has gone into standby and acpi took usb with it.
Thus there is no way to "wake up" the machine.
You can try un-plugging and re-plugging the mouse/keyboard. Not sure if it'll help tho.

any idea on this: I install Fiesty from CD and the Wireless networking never works. I install 6.10 and networking works fine. I install 6.10 and then upgrade to 7.04 and wireless works fine. Why doesnt it most likely work with the cd install of 7.10
Probable cause is firmware not being on 7.04 while it's on previous versions. Just a guess tho.
I've never used wireless networks so I really don't know.
Thanks for the guess. I was thinking the same thing.
I do however know that most firmware is closed-source and propertary software and that most wifi nicks require firmware before working, thus that's my guess.
Its funny cause all versions of Ubuntu prior to 7.04 worked perfect out of box. 7.04 will only use the wireless when upgraded from a prior version and not a fresh CD install.
In my opinion it's mamuthical. I installed it, tried it and to me it seemed incomplete.
There's no shame in running qt-apps in gnome if you've got room for the extra libraries.
I just figured it might be faster.

Well, when KDE is loaded the qt libraries are also loaded so you would see a faster load time on digikam the first time you start it. After that however you won't notice much difference unless you're short on ram and having both gtk and qt apps running. Keep in mind tho that firefox uses gtk and you will have both libraries running in kde too so the memory foot print will probably not be any smaller.
If you find it running too slow in Gnome you could try xfce or even fluxbox but the latter requires alot of setup. Atleast it did when I tried it last.
I liked XFCE but FLUXBOX takes to much work or me.
